1.text: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the reports about Jesus

2.text: and said to his servants, “This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead! That is why miraculous powers are at work in him.”

3.text: Now Herod had arrested John and bound him and put him in prison on account of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife,

4.text: because John had been telling him, “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

5.text: Although Herod wanted to kill John, he was afraid of the people, because they regarded John as a prophet.

6.text: On Herod’s birthday, however, the daughter of Herodias danced before them and pleased Herod

7.text: so much that he promised with an oath to give to her whatever she asked.

8.text: Prompted by her mother, she said, “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptist.”

9.text: The king was grieved, but because of his oaths and his guests, he ordered that her wish be granted

10.text: and sent to have John beheaded in the prison.

11.text: John’s head was brought in on a platter and presented to the girl, who carried it to her mother.

12.text: Then John’s disciples came and took his body and buried it. And they went and informed Jesus.

13.text: When Jesus heard about John, He withdrew by boat privately to a solitary place. But the crowds found out about it and followed Him on foot from the towns.

14.text: When He stepped ashore and saw a large crowd, He had compassion on them and healed their sick.

15.text: When evening came, the disciples came to Him and said, “This is a desolate place, and the hour is already late. Dismiss the crowds so they can go to the villages and buy themselves some food.”

16.text: “They do not need to go away,” Jesus replied. “You give them something to eat.”

17.text: “We have here only five loaves of bread and two fish,” they answered.

18.text: “Bring them here to Me,” Jesus said.

19.text: And He directed the crowds to sit down on the grass. Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, He spoke a blessing. Then He broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.

20.text: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

21.text: About five thousand men were fed, besides women and children.

22.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of Him to the other side, while He dismissed the crowds.

23.text: After He had dismissed them, He went up on the mountain by Himself to pray. When evening came, He was there alone,

24.text: but the boat was already far from land, buffeted by the waves because the wind was against it.

25.text: During the fourth watch of the night, Jesus went out to them, walking on the sea.

26.text: When the disciples saw Him walking on the sea, they were terrified. “It’s a ghost!” they said, and cried out in fear.

27.text: But Jesus spoke up at once: “Take courage! It is I. Do not be afraid.”

28.text: “Lord, if it is You,” Peter replied, “command me to come to You on the water.”

29.text: “Come,” said Jesus. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water, and came toward Jesus.

30.text: But when he saw the strength of the wind, he was afraid and, beginning to sink, cried out, “Lord, save me!”

31.text: Immediately Jesus reached out His hand and took hold of Peter. “You of little faith,” He said, “why did you doubt?”

32.text: And when they had climbed back into the boat, the wind died down.

33.text: Then those who were in the boat worshiped Him, saying, “Truly You are the Son of God!”

34.text: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret.

35.text: And when the men of that place recognized Jesus, they sent word to all the surrounding region. People brought all the sick to Him

36.text: and begged Him just to let them touch the fringe of His cloak. And all who touched Him were healed.
